pr_title: DHFPROD-6201: Visualize history of a record in the document metadata view

timeline.bodyText:
It's difficult to read this test and see that the 3 scenarios called out in the story - no prov records, 1 prov record, and 2 prov records - are being tested.
Also, I'd much rather see this tests in core DHF as opposed to HC. In HC, a single smoke test will do the trick.
So move the tests to core DHF, write the test against the EntitySearchService - call it GetRecordTest, since you're testing the getRecord endpoint - and I recommend a separate test method for each of the 3 scenarios. The steps don't matter. So for the first one, you can just ingest a record. For the second one, ingest it and map it. For the 3rd, ingest it, map it, and maybe use a custom step (or 2 custom steps instead of map). All values in each row in the history object need to be verified.
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: There is a getRecordHistoryTest.sjs for that covers all the scenarios. getRecord.sjs test is failing as multiple scenarios cannot be tested in ml-unit-tests due to the optic calls occurring in the same request. There appears to be a bug with Optic caching values in the same request that is being investigated.
replies.author: rahulvudutala

timeline.bodyText: To make it clear what this scenario is testing, name this "recordHasMetadataButNoProvenance".
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: This is testing all other properties in the response from getRecord endpoint except for the history. There are 3 methods for 3 different scenarios for record history
replies.author: rahulvudutala

timeline.bodyText: I think JUnit is fine here, but was the problem that you had multiple scenarios in one test module? Or was there a problem with multiple test modules, each testing one scenario? In ml-unit-test, the setup.xqy module can be used for doing setup before each test module.
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText:
This was the error.
OPTIC-INVALARGS: fn.error(null, 'OPTIC-INVALARGS', errMsg+arg); -- Invalid arguments: cannot call pattern() with invalid predicates : [object Object]
I had multiple multiple scenarios in one test module
replies.author: rahulvudutala
